title: 06 - BOS vs Liquidity Sweep vs Swing High/Low

metadata.key_emphasis: Parallel comparison of 3 concepts using 3 rules to clarify differences and prevent confusion

three_smc_rules_foundation.llm_summary: Everything in Smart Money Concepts is based on THREE fundamental rules that apply differently across different concepts. Rule 1: Inducement (IDM) - whether inducement must be taken out. Rule 2: Candle Body Close Below Inducement - whether candle body must close below inducement after sweep. Rule 3: Candle Body Close Above High - whether candle body must close above previous high (bullish) or below previous low (bearish). These same 3 rules are applied with DIFFERENT requirements for Liquidity Sweep, Break of Structure, and Swing High/Low identification. Understanding how these rules differ across concepts eliminates confusion and creates clarity in structure mapping.

rule_1.name: Inducement (IDM)
rule_1.description: Whether price must take out inducement level

rule_2.name: Candle Body Close Below Inducement
rule_2.description: Whether candle body must close below inducement after taking it out

rule_3.name: Candle Body Close Above High
rule_3.description: Whether candle body must close above previous high (bullish) or below previous low (bearish)

key_rules: Everything in SMC is based on these 3 rules
Same 3 rules apply to all concepts but with different requirements
Understanding differences prevents confusion
Must know how each rule applies to each concept
This comparative framework is foundation of true SMC trading

parallel_comparison_liquidity_sweep_bos_.llm_summary: This is the DEFINITIVE comparison table for SMC: LIQUIDITY SWEEP - Rule 1: Inducement NOT compulsory. Rule 2: Only candle wick (body close NOT valid). Rule 3: Only candle wick (body close NOT valid). BREAK OF STRUCTURE - Rule 1: Must take out inducement. Rule 2: Wick sweep OR body close both valid. Rule 3: Body MUST close above high. SWING HIGH/LOW - Rule 1: Must take out inducement. Rule 2: ONLY body close valid (wick invalid). Rule 3: Body MUST close above high. Note the critical differences: Liquidity Sweep is independent from inducement and uses only wicks. BOS requires inducement but accepts wicks for Rule 2. Swing High/Low requires inducement AND body close for both Rules 2 and 3.

rule_1_inducement.requirement: Inducement is NOT compulsory to mark liquidity sweep
rule_1_inducement.explanation: Independent from inducement - can occur anywhere

rule_2_candle_close_below_inducement.explanation: Candle body closing below inducement is NOT valid for liquidity sweep

rule_3_candle_close_above_high.explanation: Candle body closing above previous high is NOT valid liquidity sweep

liquidity_sweep.summary: Liquidity sweep = wick-only moves without body closes

rule_1_inducement.explanation: Primary and very basic rule to identify BOS

rule_2_candle_close_below_inducement.requirement: Candle wick below inducement valid, candle body below inducement valid
rule_2_candle_close_below_inducement.explanation: After taking out inducement, BOTH wick sweep AND body close validate BOS

rule_3_candle_close_above_high.requirement: Candle body MUST close above previous high (bullish) or below previous low (bearish)
rule_3_candle_close_above_high.explanation: After completing first two rules, body close is required

break_of_structure.summary: BOS = inducement required + flexible Rule 2 + strict body close Rule 3

rule_1_inducement.explanation: For true structure mapping and valid swing high/low identification
rule_1_inducement.note: Same as BOS for inducement rule

rule_2_candle_close_below_inducement.requirement: ONLY candle body close below inducement valid
rule_2_candle_close_below_inducement.explanation: Candle wick below inducement is INVALID - will NOT mark swing high/low
rule_2_candle_close_below_inducement.critical_note: If candle just sweeps inducement by wick, we will NOT mark swing high/low

rule_3_candle_close_above_high.requirement: Candle body MUST close above previous high (bullish) or below previous low (bearish)
rule_3_candle_close_above_high.explanation: After completing first two rules, body close required

swing_high_low.summary: Swing High/Low = strictest requirements - inducement + body close for both Rules 2 and 3

key_rules: Liquidity Sweep: No inducement required, wick-only for Rules 2 & 3
BOS: Inducement required, flexible Rule 2 (wick or body), strict Rule 3 (body)
Swing H/L: Inducement required, strict Rules 2 & 3 (both need body close)
BOS and Swing H/L share same inducement rule
Swing H/L is STRICTEST (body close for Rules 2 & 3)
Liquidity Sweep is most flexible (no inducement, wick-only)

Table with chart examples for each concept

liquidity_sweep_identification_clarified.llm_summary: Liquidity Sweep identification is NOW CLARIFIED in parallel with BOS and Swing H/L. Key characteristics: (1) Inducement is NOT compulsory - liquidity sweeps can occur independently anywhere in market. (2) Only candle WICK counts - if candle body closes above previous high (bullish) or below previous low (bearish), it invalidates the liquidity sweep and becomes something else (possibly BOS). (3) Liquidity sweep is characterized by price wicking through a level but closing back inside the range. Examples: High liquidity sweep = wick above high, body closes below high. Low liquidity sweep = wick below low, body closes above low. If body closes beyond the level, it's NOT a liquidity sweep.

characteristics.independence: Not dependent on inducement - can occur anywhere
characteristics.wick_only: Only wick breaks count as liquidity sweep
characteristics.body_invalidates: Body close beyond level invalidates liquidity sweep
characteristics.purpose: Hunt stop losses and pending orders

invalid_liquidity_sweep.scenario: Candle body closes above previous high (bullish) or below previous low (bearish)
invalid_liquidity_sweep.result: Invalid liquidity sweep - becomes something else (possibly BOS if inducement taken)
invalid_liquidity_sweep.marking: Do NOT mark as liquidity sweep

key_rules: Inducement NOT required for liquidity sweep
Only wick counts - body close invalidates
Wick above high + body below high = valid high liquidity sweep
Wick below low + body above low = valid low liquidity sweep
Body close beyond level = NOT liquidity sweep
Independent concept - can occur anywhere in market

visual_evidence.description: Liquidity sweep examples showing valid and invalid cases

bos_vs_swing_high_low_rule_2_difference.llm_summary: The CRITICAL DIFFERENCE between BOS and Swing High/Low is in Rule 2 (Candle Body Close Below Inducement). For BOS: After taking out inducement, BOTH candle wick sweep AND candle body close below inducement are VALID. This gives BOS flexibility - either method fulfills Rule 2. For Swing High/Low: After taking out inducement, ONLY candle body close below inducement is VALID. Candle wick sweep is INVALID - if candle just sweeps inducement by wick, we will NOT mark it as swing high/low. This is the key distinction: BOS accepts wick OR body for Rule 2, while Swing High/Low requires strict body close for Rule 2. Both share same requirements for Rules 1 (inducement required) and 3 (body close above high required).

bos_rule_2.requirement: After taking out inducement, wick OR body both valid
bos_rule_2.note: Either method fulfills Rule 2 for BOS

swing_high_low_rule_2.requirement: After taking out inducement, ONLY body close valid
invalid_scenarios: Candle wick sweeps inducement but body doesn't close below (invalid)
swing_high_low_rule_2.critical_note: If candle just sweeps inducement by wick, we will NOT mark swing high and lows
swing_high_low_rule_2.emphasis: ONLY candle body close below inducement - I repeat, we will consider ONLY candle body close

why_this_matters.structure_mapping: Swing high/low mapping is stricter because it defines market structure
why_this_matters.bos_indication: BOS can be more lenient as it's just indication of trend continuation
why_this_matters.precision: Swing high/low requires precise body close for accurate structure
why_this_matters.filtering: Stricter swing high/low rules filter out false structure breaks

shared_rules.rule_1: Both require inducement to be taken out (same)
shared_rules.rule_3: Both require body close above high/below low (same)
shared_rules.difference_only_in_rule_2: The ONLY difference is Rule 2 strictness

key_rules: BOS Rule 2: Wick OR body both valid (flexible)
Swing H/L Rule 2: ONLY body valid (strict)
Wick-only inducement sweep = Valid for BOS, Invalid for Swing H/L
This is the key distinction between BOS and Swing H/L
Rules 1 and 3 are identical for both concepts
Rule 2 is where they differ critically

key_quotes: Today, we will discuss the difference between break of structure, liquidity sweep, and swing high and swing lows.
We will study this topic for bullish market structure and be sure, these rules and case study will be 100% applicable to bearish market structure as well.
Everything is based on these three rules.
First one is inducement. And if you do not have knowledge about inducement, then you must study second and third lecture.
Second rule is based on candle closing below inducement. It's mean either candle body closed below inducement or not after taking it out.
Third rule is based on candle body closing above previous high in bullish market and below previous low in bearish market.
If you have not watched the first five lectures, then these points and rules may confuse you.
We will study liquidity sweep, break of structure and swing high and lows in parallel comparison so that you can easily differentiate amongst these three.
Note that inducement is not compulsory to mark liquidity sweep. This is independent from inducement.
To mark a valid break of structure, market must take out the inducement. This is primary and very basic rule.
To mark valid swing high and lows, market must take out the inducement.
Note that inducement rule is same for BOS and swing high low mapping.
We will only count candle wick in liquidity sweep. Candle body closing above previous high or low will invalidate the liquidity sweep.
After taking out inducement, candle wick and candle body both validate the break of structure.
After taking out inducement, we will count only candle body closing below inducement. Make notes, I repeat, we will consider only candle body close below inducement.
If candle just sweep the inducement by wick, then we will not mark swing high and lows.
For liquidity sweep, we will only count candle wick. Remember candle body closing above previous high is not valid liquidity sweep.
After completing first two rules, candle body must close above the previous high in bullish market.
Because market respected all of these three rules.

critical_insights.main_teaching: Parallel comparison of 3 concepts using 3 rules eliminates confusion and creates clarity
critical_insights.framework: Same 3 rules applied with different requirements across concepts

key_distinctions.liquidity_sweep: No inducement, wick-only for all rules
key_distinctions.bos: Inducement required, flexible Rule 2, strict Rule 3
